greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of singular 2 X 2 matrices over Z(n) (i.e., with determinant = 0).
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 (terms 1..1000 from T. D. Noe)
formula: Sum_{k=1..n} a(k) ~ Pi^2 * n^4 / (24*Zeta(3)). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jan 31 2019
Proof: a(n) is multiplicative with a(p^e) = p^(2*e - 1)*(p^(e+1) + p^e - 1), A069097(n) is multiplicative with A069097(p^e) = p^(e-1)*(p^e*(p+1)-1), so a(p^e) = p^e*A069097(p^e). (End)
mathematica: f[p_, e_] := p^(2*e - 1)*(p^(e + 1) + p^e - 1); a[n_] := Times @@ f @@@ FactorInteger[n]; Array[a, 100] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Oct 22 2020 *)
results.author: _David W. Wilson_
